greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = total number of regions in all arrangements of n circles in the affine plane forming k regions, excluding the regions that do not belong to the circles.
comment: In other words: not counting the regions between circles.
Consider the arrangements of n circles described in A250001.
example: For n = 3 and k = 5 there are 2 arrangements of 3 circles in the affine plane forming 5 regions, excluding the regions that do not belong to the circles, so T(3,5) = 2*5 = 10.
For n = 3 and k = 6 there is only one arrangement of 3 circles in the affine plane forming 6 regions, excluding the regions that do not belong to the circles, so T(3,6) = 1*6 = 6.
Of course, there is a right triangle of all zeros starting from the second row.
xref: First differs from A274818 at a(10).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 07 2016
